Jeremy Steven Suarez[1] (born July 6, 1990) is an American actor, comedian and former child actor best known for his role as Jordan Thomkins on The Bernie Mac Show and as Raymond Wilkes in Chicago Hope (1996-1998). and for his film roles as Tyson Tidwell in Jerry Maguire (1996), Russel in Fat Albert (2004), his voice role as Koda in Brother Bear (2003) and Brother Bear 2 (2006) and Cooper Folly in Angry Video Game Nerd: The Movie (2014).

Biography[]

In 1996, he made his debut in Jerry Maguire as Rod Tidwell's son Tyson.[2] He voiced Koda in two Disney films, Brother Bear[3] and Brother Bear 2.[4] He also played roles in many television shows, such as The Wayans Bros., Chicago Hope, King of the Hill, Jordan, the nephew of Bernie Mac on The Bernie Mac Show.

Suarez cited comedians like Chris Rock, Eddie Murphy, Richard Pryor, Kevin Hart, Cheech Marin, George Lopez, Freddie Prinze, Bill Cosby, Paul Rooney, George Carlin, Redd Foxx, Louis C.K., Paul Rodriguez, D. L. Hughley, Jerry Seinfeld and Dave Chappelle as his influences.

Suarez appeared on Larry King Live in 2008 with his fellow cast to discuss Mac's death.[5] In 2009, he voiced a puppet on Nike commercials during the 2009 NBA Playoffs. He voiced Kai in the animated feature film, Zambezia and starred in Angry Video Game Nerd: The Movie as "Cooper".[6]

Suarez is of African and Cuban descent.
